page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Through the area flows the River Goyt. To the North of the block this has been dammed to make two reservoirs to provide water for Stockport.The Goyt Valley to the North of Whaley Bridge is very beautiful and is a popular tourist attraction but as it reaches Whaley Bridge it becomes very polluted from industrial effluent. The 2 other reservoirs in the area were built as feeders for the canal.At one time the canal terminus at Whaley was linked to one at Cromford by a tram and later a railway line.The remains of this can still be traced. The school is situated in the part of Whaley known as Horwich End.Botany Mill here now bleaches cotton. There is a mixture of old and new houses in the area parts of which used to be mined for coal.There is little industry here now.
